alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 2:48PM EDT until September 04 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Chattooga County in northwestern Georgia... Southwestern Dade County in northwestern Georgia... Southern Walker County in northwestern Georgia... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lafayette, La Fayette, Center Post, Naomi, Suttles Mill and Villanow. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
